::: {#main-content .container role="main"}
::: {#chapter-assessment .section}
[1.12. ]{.section-number}Chapter Assessment[¬∂](#chapter-assessment "Permalink to this heading"){.headerlink}
============================================================================================================

**Check your understanding**

::: {.runestone}
-   [Because computers are better at solving
    problems.]{#assess_question1_1_1_opt_a}
-   Computers aren\'t necessarily better at solving problems, though
    often they can be quicker than humans. Additionally, algorithms can
    be used to solve non-computer related problems.
-   [So that you don\'t have to solve the problem
    yourself.]{#assess_question1_1_1_opt_b}
-   While it is beneficial to have a set of instructions that others can
    follow, this isn\'t the best answer. By creating the algorithm, you
    solve a problem for yourself and others.
-   [So that you have a general solution to a
    problem.]{#assess_question1_1_1_opt_c}
-   Yes, by creating a general solution you can then express it as a
    program if you choose, and then use a computer to automate the
    execution.
-   [Because you need a set of instructions to
    follow.]{#assess_question1_1_1_opt_d}
-   While it is beneficial to have a set of instructions as that is what
    an algorithm \*\*is\*\*, it is not \*\*why\*\* we would want to
    create one.
:::

::: {.runestone .explainer .ac_section}
::: {#assess_question1_1_2 component="activecode" question_label="1.12.2"}
::: {#assess_question1_1_2_question .ac_question}
Write code to print out the phrase "Hello World".
:::
:::
:::
